short_summary: Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) need qPCR instrument and accessories for eDNA analysis.
description: Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) requires a real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) instrument and accessories for measures of DNA concentrations to support environmental DNA (eDNA) analysis.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
## Request for Proposal: qPCR Instrument

### Solicitation Information

* **Solicitation Number**: WS4159105927
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-12-08T14:00:00
* **Tender Status**: Expiré (Expired)

### Procurement Details

* **Procurement Category**: GD
* **Notice Type**: Demande de propositions (Request for Proposal)
* **Procurement Method**: Concurrentielle - Invitation ouverte à soumissionner (Competitive - Open bidding)

### Contract Requirements

* **qPCR Instrument**: Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) requires a real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) instrument and accessories for measures of DNA concentrations to support environmental DNA (eDNA) analysis.
* **Additional Features**: The qPCR instrument should have additional features currently unavailable to the program, which will be used for research and development of eDNA to support its use by DFO as a tool for salmon and fish habitat assessments.

### Contracting Entity Information

* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Contracting Entity Address**: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Québec, K1A 0S5, Canada

### Contact Information

* **Contact Name**: Chris Morton
* **Contact Email**: chris.morton@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* **Notice URL**: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17980946?extsite=MTc5ODA5NDZfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

### UNSPSC Code

* **UNSPSC Code**: *Indicating and recording instruments
* **Description**: Instruments indicateurs et enregistreurs

Please note that all information is located in the rewritten entry above, but I removed the extra info that was not related to the solicitation.

All URLs were kept as is and when possible, kept a few pieces of the french description but the more detailed ones were kept in english as above.

Also I obviously formatted the text to be readable and nice to look at. You know me, best technical writer around! You can use the output into whatever format you need it for.
